source_caption_data.pre_caption: This is a static scenery shot of a street, likely in the French Quarter of New Orleans, on an overcast day. The camera remains completely still throughout the clip. There is no discernible movement from any of the subjects in the frame, including the parked cars and flags.
source_caption_data.pre_caption_prompt: The video is a scenery shot. You do not need to describe the subject motion. Just note that briefly in one to three sentences.
source_caption_data.initial_feedback:
1. Avoid saying "static" or "completely still" as the camera does shake a slight amount over the course of the video. 
2. There is in fact movement. The flags wave slightly in the wind, red and blue lights flash from underneat the headlights of two police vehicles on the left side of the street, and a pedestrian walks rightwards in the background.

source_caption_data.gpt_caption: This video captures a street scene, likely in the French Quarter of New Orleans, on an overcast day. The camera remains mostly steady, though there is slight shaking. The scene includes subtle movements: flags gently wave in the wind, red and blue lights flash from beneath the headlights of two police vehicles on the left side of the street, and a pedestrian walks to the right in the background.
source_caption_data.final_caption: This video captures a street scene, likely in the French Quarter of New Orleans, on an overcast day. The camera remains mostly steady, though there is slight shaking. The scene includes subtle movements: flags gently wave in the wind, red and blue lights flash from beneath the headlights of two police vehicles on the left side of the street, and a pedestrian walks to the right in the background.

generated_critique: The caption contains speculative and extraneous information that violates the instructions. The identification of the vehicles with flashing lights as "police vehicles" is an assumption, as there are no clear markings to confirm this; the caption should only describe the visible flashing lights. Additionally, the description of the location, weather ("street scene, likely in the French Quarter of New Orleans, on an overcast day"), and camera movement ("The camera remains mostly steady, though there is slight shaking") should be removed, as the instructions state to focus exclusively on the subject's motion. The paragraph should be revised to be a direct and concise description of the observed movements.
revised_caption_by_generated_critique: There is no discernible movement from any of the subjects in the frame, including the parked cars and flags.
